summary: This bill, the Protections and Transparency in the Workplace Act, amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to require public companies to disclose information about covered discrimination and harassment claims in their reports. This includes details on the number of claims, settlements, and training programs. The bill also mandates independent investigations of harassment claims, requires mandatory training for employees (including bystander training), and an annual workplace survey. Furthermore, the bill establishes a whistleblower tip line.
